definition: Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Oh, it's a reserved opera named "The Monkey Creates Havoc in Heaven".
sentences.chinese: 哦，那是一场保留剧目，名叫“大闹天宫”。

sentences.english: I once stage-managed a repertory theatre.
sentences.chinese: 以前我曾在一专用剧场担任保留剧目的舞台总监。

sentences.english: The repertory company revived plays from 30 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 该保留剧目轮演剧团重演30年以前的戏剧。

sentences.english: The repertory of a concert band includes marches, and other forms of music.
sentences.chinese: 乐队的保留剧目包括进行曲和其他形式的音乐。

definition: the world of Chinese opera/theatrical circles
opera highlights performed as independent pieces
maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
Taming of the Shrew, play by William Shakespeare
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
